title: How to Organize an MP3 Player

steps.headline: Sync your MP3 player to a computer.
Look at the settings section.
steps.description: You will probably be able to clear your MP3 player completely, load only selected songs and lots of other things.

steps.headline: Clear your MP3 player of all of your songs.
If you have unwanted songs on it, set the MP3 player only to load selected songs.
Move your songs into relevant playlists; e.g.
steps.description: rock music, pop music, R&B music, country music or, songs for jogging, songs for parties, songs for relaxing.

steps.headline: Sync the songs you'd like on your MP3 player through your computer.
steps.description: While you're doing this, it should be charging, too.

steps.headline: Unplug the MP3 player, and it should be a little bit more organised than before!

tyn: Some songs to put on the MP3 player
text: Sync your MP3 player to a computer.  Look at the settings section. You will probably be able to clear your MP3 player completely, load only selected songs and lots of other things. Clear your MP3 player of all of your songs.  If you have unwanted songs on it, set the MP3 player only to load selected songs.  Move your songs into relevant playlists; e.g. rock music, pop music, R&B music, country music or, songs for jogging, songs for parties, songs for relaxing. Sync the songs you'd like on your MP3 player through your computer. While you're doing this, it should be charging, too. Unplug the MP3 player, and it should be a little bit more organised than before!
sentences: Sync your MP3 player to a computer.
You will probably be able to clear your MP3 player completely, load only selected songs and lots of other things.
Clear your MP3 player of all of your songs.
If you have unwanted songs on it, set the MP3 player only to load selected songs.
Move your songs into relevant playlists; e.g.
rock music, pop music, R&B music, country music or, songs for jogging, songs for parties, songs for relaxing.
Sync the songs you'd like on your MP3 player through your computer.
While you're doing this, it should be charging, too.
Unplug the MP3 player, and it should be a little bit more organised than before!
